description:
In an age when innovative scholarly work is at an all-time high, the
academy itself is being rocked by structural change. Funding is
plummeting. Tenure increasingly seems a prospect for only the elite few.
Ph.D.'s are going begging for even adjunct work. Into this tumult steps
Cary Nelson, with a no- holds-barred account of recent developments in
higher education.

Eloquent and witty, Manifesto of a Tenured Radical urges academics to
apply the theoretical advances of the last twenty years to an analysis of
their own practices and standards of behavior. In the process, Nelson
offers a devastating critique of current inequities and a detailed
proposal for change in the form of A Twelve-Step Program for Academia.
